Location (eg: where is the object): Color (eg: what color is the object)
Physical orientation (eg: how is the object positioned or oriented)
Full or empty (eg: is a container full or empty)
On or off (eg: is a light or machine on or off)
Broken or intact (eg: is a piece of equipment or object broken or intact)
Visible or hidden (eg: is an object or material visible or hidden from view)
Open or closed (eg: is a door, window, or container open or closed)
Wet or dry (e.g., a towel, a sponge)
Tangled or untangled (e.g., a necklace, a rope)
Inflated or deflated (e.g., a balloon, a tire)
Bent or straight (e.g., a paperclip, a straw)
Knotted or untied (e.g., shoelaces, a ribbon)
Stretched or unstretched (e.g., a rubber band, a string)
Melted or solid (e.g., an ice cream, a candle)
Spilled or contained (e.g., a drink, a container)
Flipped or unflipped (e.g., a switch, a pancake)
Clean or dirty (e.g., is a surface clean or dirty)
Fresh or spoiled (e.g., is food fresh or spoiled)
Organized or messy (e.g., is a space organized or messy)
Smooth or rough (e.g., is a surface smooth or rough)
Securely fastened or loose (e.g., is a lid securely fastened or loose)
Complete or incomplete (e.g., is a puzzle complete or incomplete)
Contained or spilled (e.g., is a liquid contained or spilled)
Stable or shaky (e.g., is a table stable or shaky)
Awake or asleep (e.g., is a creature awake or asleep)
Attached or detached (e.g., is a part attached or detached)
Smell (e.g., does the object smell pleasant, foul, or neutral)
Taste (e.g., does the object taste sweet, salty, bitter, or sour)
Texture (e.g., is the object smooth, rough, or bumpy)
Shape (e.g., is the object round, square, triangular, or irregular)
Size (e.g., is the object big, small, or medium-sized)
Weight (e.g., is the object heavy, light, or moderate)
State of Matter (e.g., is the object solid, liquid, or gas)
Rigidity (e.g., is the object hard, soft, or bendable)
Strength (e.g., is the object strong, weak, or okay strong)
